APPLICATION PURPOSE: TO DEVELOP AND DEMONSTRATE A SYSTEM THAT CAN IDENTIFY QUANTIFY AND MONITOR BOTH THE INTERNAL AND EXTERNAL DEFECTS OF RAIL TRACK AND TIE STRUCTURES WITH THE POTENTIAL FOR HIGH-SPEED FULL TRACK SECTION INSPECTION.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THE WORK PLAN IS COMPOSED OF THREE TASKS: TECHNOLOGY DEVELOPMENT DEMONSTRATION AND EVALUATION. THE WORK PLAN ALLOWS A RAPID TECHNOLOGY DEMONSTRATION DATA COLLECTION AND EVALUATION EFFORT.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS PROJECT WILL BE IMPLEMENTED AS DESCRIBED ABOVE THEN REPORTS WILL BE PREPARED DOCUMENTING THE OUTCOMES. IT IS THE INTENDED OUTCOME OF THE PARTNERS THAT THE RESEARCH WILL LEAD TO A DEVELOPED PRODUCT THAT WILL EVENTUALLY BE APPLIED AS A COMMERCIAL PRODUCT WITH THE GOAL OF DEPLOYMENT AT SCALE.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: UTAH TRANSIT AUTHORITY OTHER TRANSIT AGENCIES AND ANY RAIL OPERATORS WHO WOULD BENEFIT FROM HAVING AVAILABLE IMPROVED TECHNOLOGY FOR HIGH-SPEED REAL-TIME FULL TRACK SECTION INSPECTION.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N/A

APPLICATION PURPOSE: SDDOT IS COMING IN FOR A FFY 2019 INNOVATIONS IN TRANSIT PUBLIC SAFETY PROJECT DISCRETIONARY GRANT THAT WEST RIVER TRANSIT AUTHORITY INC (DBA AS PRAIRIE HILLS TRANSIT) APPLIED FOR DIRECTLY THROUGH FTA. SDDOT IS A PASS-THROUGH ENTITY FOR THE FUNDS THAT WEST RIVER TRANSIT AUTHORITY WAS SELECTED BY FTA. SDDOT IS COMING IN FOR THE TOTAL AWARD AMOUNT OF $60000 FOR TRAINING ON IDENTIFICATION OF AND EXPANDING AWARENESS OF HUMAN TRAFFICKING IMPLEMENTING PROTOCOLS FOR REPORTING AND CREATING BENEFICIAL PARTNERSHIPS TO PROMOTE COMMUNITY PARTICIPATION. THE DISCRETIONARY ID IS D2020-HTIT-023.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FOR THE TRAINING ON IDENTIFICATION OF AND EXPANDING AWARENESS OF HUMAN TRAFFICKING IMPLEMENTING PROTOCOLS FOR REPORTING AND CREATING BENEFICIAL PARTNERSHIPS TO PROMOTE COMMUNITY PARTICIPATION.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: TO RAISE AWARENESS TO HUMAN TRAFFICKING IN SOUTH DAKOTA.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE ACTIVITIES PERFORMED WILL BENEFIT THE COMMUNITIES AND RESIDENTS OF SOUTH DAKOTA.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: PHT WILL WORK WITH A NATIONALLY KNOWN CONSULTANT TO PERFORM HUMAN TRAFFICKING TRAINING AND OUTREACH.

PURPOSE: IN THIS APPLICATION BI-STATE DEVELOPMENT AGENCY IS APPLYING FOR THE FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $187500 AWARDED UNDER THE HUMAN TRAFFICKING AWARENESS PUBLIC SAFETY INITIATIVE GRANT. TOTAL FEDERAL FUNDS OF $187500 ARE BEING REQUESTED IN THIS APPLICATION; BSDA WILL PROVIDE A LOCAL MATCH OF $62500 FOR A TOTAL OF $250000 IN THIS PROJECT BEING PROGRAMMED IN THIS APPLICATION. BSD MATCH IS DERIVED FROM LOCAL SALES TAX. BI-STATE METRO IS AWARE THE BUDGET IS SET UP AS A 75/25 FEDERAL TO LOCAL FUNDING RATIO.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: UNDER PRE AWARD AUTHORITY ACTIVITIES UNDER THIS PROJECT WHOLE PERSON APPROACH TO REDUCING CRIME ON STL METRO TRANSIT COMMENCED MID-SUMMER 2020. THROUGH ADDITIONAL TEACHINGS AND TECHNIQUES DESIGNED TO HUMANIZE THE INTERACTION BETWEEN CUSTOMERS AND OPERATORS METROS FRONT-LINE STAFF WILL BE MORE EMPOWERED TO RECOGNIZE SIGNS OF INDIVIDUAL AND COMMUNITY DISTRESS SUCH AS INSTANCES OF HUMAN TRAFFICKING REACT APPROPRIATED WITH THE GUIDANCE OF TRAUMA-INFORMED APPROACHES TO PRIORITIZE EVERYONES WELLBEING; AND RESOLVE DIFFICULT SITUATIONS ON OUR TRANSIT SYSTEM BEFORE THEY THREATEN PUBLIC AND/OR OPERATOR SAFETY. PROJECT WILL INCLUDE TRAUMA-INFORMED TRAINING DE-ESCALATION TRAINING HUMAN TRAFFICKING TRAINING AND OUTREACH THROUGH COMMUNITY DE-ESCALATION TEAMS. AS IDENTIFIED IN OUR DISCRETIONARY APPLICATION WE COLLABORATED AND ARE PARTNERING WITH ALIVE WELL STL BETTER FAMILY LIFE INC. AND HEALING ACTION/CATE COALITION FOR THE OVERALL PROJECT DESIGN AND IMPLEMENTATION. TRAINING WILL BE PERFORMED BY BI-STATE METRO STAFF.THIS PROJECTS FULL DESCRIPTION IS LISTED IN THE EXTENDED BUDGET DESCRIPTION AND UPLOADED TO THE APPLICATION DOCUMENTS SECTION OF THIS APPLICATION (1830-2021-1 PROGRAM OF PROJECT ACTIVITIES.DOCX). EXPECTED OUTCOMES: ACTIVITIES UNDER THIS AWARD WILL ENHANCE EMPLOYEE TRAINING TO RECOGNIZE SIGNS OF HUMAN TRAFFICKING AND ADDRESS OTHER PUBLIC SAFETY INCIDENTS. THROUGH COLLABORATIVE TRAINING PROGRAMS EMPLOYEES WILL GAIN AN INCREASED SENSE OF AWARENESS AND ABILITY TO IDENTIFY SIGNS OF DISTRESS THREATS CONFLICTS AND POSSIBLE VICTIMS AND PERPETRATORS OF HUMAN TRAFFICKING THAT MAY BE OCCURRING ON OR NEAR THE TRANSIT MODES. THESE PROGRAMS WILL TEACH EFFECTIVE METHODS OF DE-ESCALATION OF CONFLICT BEFORE THE SAFETY OF OPERATORS AND OTHER TRANSIT CUSTOMERS ARE THREATENED.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE DE-ESCALATION TRAINING PROJECT WILL BENEFIT RIDERS OF THE METRO TRANSIT SYSTEM METRO FRONT-LINE STAFF INCLUDING OPERATORS ADMINISTRATION AND PUBLIC SAFETY STAFF AND THE ST. LOUIS COMMUNITY OVERALL BY WORKING WITH LOCAL PARTNERS TO DE-ESCALATE SITUATIONS BEFORE THEY INTENSIFY AND TO MITIGATE CRIMINAL ACTIVITIES ON THE TRANSIT SYSTEM.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES ARE BEING PROGRAMMED INTO THIS AMENDMENT APPLICATION. TIP/STIP PROGRAM: THE PROJECT IDENTIFIED IN THIS APPLICATION IS INCLUDED IN THE AMENDMENT TO THE FY2021-2024 TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAMS APPROVED BY THE EAST WEST GATEWAY BOARD OF DIRECTORS ON FEBRUARY 24 2021. ONE DOT LETTER ISSUED MARCH 2 2021 APPROVES THE INCLUSION OF THE AFOREMENTIONED TIPS IN THE STIP (MISSOURI). DOCUMENTATION OF THESE PROGRAM PLAN INCLUSIONS AND APPROVAL LETTERS HAVE BEEN UPLOADED TO THE APPLICATION DOCUMENTS SECTION OF THIS APPLICATION. RELATIVE PAGES FOR THE ACTIVITIES PROGRAMMED INTO THIS APPLICATION HAVE BEEN EXTRACTED FROM THE TIP DOCUMENT AND UPLOADED TO THE PROJECT PLAN INFORMATION SECTION OF THIS APPLICATION. MS 03-04-2022
FY16 RIDES TO WELLNESS INITIATIVE - ACCESSING RIDES TO COMMUNITY HEALTHCARE (ARCH)

THIS GRANT WILL UTILIZE FY 2014 DISCRETIONARY LOW OR NO EMISSION VEHICLE DEPLOYMENT PROGRAM (LONO) FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $6343890 (FEDERAL) $1119510 (LOCAL)FOR A TOTAL OF $7463400 TO PURCHASE SIX ALL ELECTRIC BUSES AND INSTALL TWO CHARGING STATIONS. THE PROJECT IN TOTAL HAS BEEN AMENDED INTO THE TIP AND STIP (PROJECT NUMBER TRF-0016-15E)THE LOCAL SHARE WILL COME STATE OF MINNESOTA GENERAL FUND AND SALES TAX ON AUTO SALES AS WELL AS CITY OF DULUTH LOCAL PROPERTY TAX.THE PURPOSE OF THE LOW OR NO EMISSION VEHICLE DEPLOYMENT PROGRAM (LONO) IS TO PUT A NEW GENERATION OF ADVANCED NON-POLLUTING TRANSIT BUSES ON THE ROAD IN COMMUNITIES NATIONWIDE. THE FUNDS ARE INTENDED TO ENCOURAGE MORE WIDESPREAD ADOPTION OF RELIABLE GREEN ENERGY BUSES INTO TRANSIT FLEETS.THE FTAS LOW OR NO EMISSION VEHICLE DEPLOYMENT PROGRAM WAS ESTABLISHED UNDER THE MOVING AHEAD FOR PROGRESS IN THE 21ST CENTURY ACT (MAP-21). IT FOCUSES ON COMMERCIALIZING THE CLEANEST AND MOST ENERGY-EFFICIENT U.S.-MADE TRANSIT BUSES TO HELP REDUCE EMISSIONS LIKE CARBON DIOXIDE AND CARBON MONOXIDE. THE LONO PROGRAM BUILDS ON THE SUCCESS OF FTAS NATIONAL FUEL CELL BUS PROGRAM WHICH INVESTED IN THE RESEARCH DEVELOPMENT AND TESTING OF ALTERNATIVE FUELS AND RELATED EQUIPMENT SUCH AS ELECTRIC CHARGING STATIONS FOR THE TRANSIT INDUSTRY. THIS PROGRAM SUCCESSFULLY COMMITTED $90 MILLION OVER SEVEN YEARS FOR INNOVATIVE RESEARCH DEMONSTRATION AND DEPLOYMENT PROJECTS TO REDUCE THE COST OF FUEL CELLS FOR TRANSIT USE. THE PROGRAM RECEIVED ITS FINAL FUNDING IN FY2013.AS PER THE GRANT APPLICATION THE DTA HAS TEAMED WITH PROTERRA AS THE ELECTRIC BUS MANUFACTURER AND THE CENTER FOR TRANSPORTATION AND THE ENVIRONMENT (CTE)FOR THE STUDY ELEMENTS.THE PROJECT MANAGEMENT PLAN HAS BEEN ATTACHED. THE ORGANIZATIONAL PARTNERS TEXT HAS BEEN ATTACHED AS A PDF FILE. CTES WORK PROGRAM HAS ALSO BEEN ATTACHED.THE ONLY MONETARY CHANGES MADE TO THE ORIGINAL APPLICATION IS THAT THE COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH THE DTA MANAGEMENT OF THE PROJECT HAVE BEEN SHIFTED TO BUS COSTS TO INSTALL THE DTAS ITS SYSTEMS AND SECURITY CAMERA SYSTEM.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: ON APRIL 6 2015 FTA AWARDED THE MBTA $4139188 IN 5312 RESEARCH FUNDS FOR THE LOW OR NO EMISSION VEHICLE DEPLOYMENT PROGRAM (LONO) TO PROCURE AND DEPLOY FIVE BATTERY-ELECTRIC ZERO-EMISSION 60-FT ARTICULATED BUSES AND ASSOCIATED EQUIPMENT TO SERVE THE MBTAS SILVER LINE. FEDERAL REGISTER NOTICE (DATED 4/6/15) AND ORIGINAL PROGRAM APPLICATION ARE ATTACHED.THE FUNDS ARE INTENDED TO ENCOURAGE MORE WIDESPREAD ADOPTION OF RELIABLE GREEN ENERGY BUSES INTO TRANSIT FLEETS. THE DEPLOYMENT OF ZERO-EMISSION BATTERY-ELECTRIC BUSES AT MBTA WILL BE A MODEL FOR SUSTAINABLE AND RESPONSIBLE TRANSIT OPERATIONS THAT IS REPLICABLE TO TRANSIT AGENCIES NATIONWIDE. NOT ONLY WILL THE VEHICLE TECHNOLOGY PROVIDE SIGNIFICANT REDUCTIONS IN PETROLEUM FUEL CONSUMPTION AND GHG EMISSIONS BUT THESE BUSES WILL CREATE A SIGNIFICANT REDUCTION IN OPERATING COSTS.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: SCOPE:TO ACCOMPLISH THIS DEPLOYMENT THE MBTA WILL PARTNER WITH NEW FLYER AND THE CENTER FOR TRANSPORTATION AND THE ENVIRONMENT (CTE) BOTH RECOGNIZED AS LEADERS IN CLEAN TRANSIT DEPLOYMENTS. NEW FLYER IS THE LARGEST TRANSIT BUS OEM IN THE US AND CTE HAS UNPARALLELED EXPERIENCE IN EFFECTIVELY MANAGING AND IMPLEMENTING ZERO-EMISSION BUS DEPLOYMENT PROGRAMS.WITH THE EXCEPTION OF MBTAS DUAL MODE FLEET OF 32 BUSES CURRENTLY ALL 60 LOW FLOOR ARTICULATED BUSES IN SERVICE TODAY IN NORTH AMERICA UTILIZE THE REAR AXLE TO PROVIDE PROPULSION POWER BY PUSHING THE BUS. DURING WINTER MONTHS WHEN SNOW AND ICE ARE PRESENT ON THE ROADWAY REAR AXLE PROPULSION RESULTS IN SIGNIFICANT TRACTION ISSUES CAUSING THE BUS TO JACK KNIFE. SUBSEQUENTLY THE MBTA PROVIDES 40 BUSES TO REPLACE 60 BUSES ON SURFACE ROUTES NORMALLY OPERATED BY 60 BUSES WITH REAR AXLE PROPULSION WHENEVER SNOW OR EXTREME ICE CONDITIONS ARE FORECASTED. MBTA ROUTES OPERATE THROUGH RESIDENTIAL NEIGHBORHOODS WHERE NOISE FROM THE DIESEL OR CNG ENGINE HAS BEEN AN ISSUE.AS A SOLUTION THE MBTA IS PROPOSING TO REPLACE FIVE (5) 60 BUSES FOR SILVER LINE SERVICE WITH NEW FLYERS XE60 FULLY BATTERY-ELECTRIC BUS WHICH INCLUDES A SECOND POWERED DRIVE AXLE TO ENHANCE SAFE OPERATION DURING THE WINTER MONTHS. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO INCLUDE THE INSTALLATION OF A 450 KW RAPID CHARGING STATION IN THE UNDERGROUND SILVER LINE TUNNEL AT THE SOUTH STATION TERMINAL TO FAST-CHARGE THE BUSES DURING SCHEDULED LAYOVERS. ; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: SAFER AND MORE RELIABLE WINTERTIME OPERATION SUBSTANTIALLY LOWER ENERGY AND MAINTENANCE COSTS REDUCED MBTA DEPENDENCE ON FOSSIL FUELS ZERO TAILPIPE EMISSIONS IN INNER-CITY NEIGHBORHOODS WITH HIGH RATES OF ASTHMA AND RESPIRATORY AILMENTS AMONG YOUNG PEOPLE AND SENIOR CITIZENS REDUCED NOISE POLLUTION IN SURROUNDING NEIGHBORHOODS BETTER VEHICLE PERFORMANCE AND PROPULSION SYSTEM DURABILITY INCREASED COMFORT FOR THE OPERATOR AND PASSENGERS; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: BUS RIDERS; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

BUDGET REVISION 7/2020:THE $223265 IN UNEXPENDED FUNDING WILL BE APPLIED TO COMMUNICATIONS OUTREACH AND MEDIA STRATEGY FOR THE FAIRMOUNT/INDIGO COMMUTER RAIL PILOT SINCE THE PROJECT ORIGINALLY PROPOSED UNDER THIS GRANT IS NO LONGER BEING ADVANCED.ORIGINAL GRANT:THE MASSACHUSETTS BAY TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY (MBTA) IS REQUESTING $352500 IN FLEXED FHWA TCSP FUNDING FOR PLANNING AND ENHANCEMENTS ON THE FAIRMOUNT CORRIDOR. FHWA OPERATING BUDGET TRANSFER DOCUMENT DATED 3/11/2013 IS ATTACHED. BACKGROUNDTHE FAIRMOUNT CORRIDOR COMMUTER RAIL LINE OPERATED BY THE MBTA CURRENTLY RUNS FROM SOUTH STATION SOUTH THROUGH THE BOSTON NEIGHBORHOODS OF DORCHESTER ROXBURY MATTAPAN AND TERMINATES IN THE READVILLE SECTION OF HYDE PARK. IT CONSISTS OF APPROXIMATELY 9.2 MILES OF TRACK SEVEN STATIONS (INCLUDING THE THREE NEWEST ONES) AND FORTY-ONE BRIDGES. IT IS THE ONLY COMMUTER RAIL BRANCH THAT EXCLUSIVELY SERVES THE CITY OF BOSTON AND MBTA#8242;S URBAN CORE. IN OCTOBER OF 2002 THE MBTA PERFORMED A FEASIBILITY STUDY (ATTACHED IN TEAM) TO IDENTIFY INFRASTRUCTURE UPGRADES NEEDED TO MAINTAIN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR ON THE FAIRMOUNT LINE. THE IDENTIFIED UPGRADES INCLUDED REHABILITATING EXISTING STATIONS RECONSTRUCTING SEVERAL BRIDGES CONSTRUCTING A NEW TRACK INTERLOCKING SWITCHING SYSTEM UPGRADING THE EXISTING SIGNAL SYSTEM AND DE-LEADING PAINTING AND MINOR REPAIR WORK TO OTHER BRIDGES.THE FEASIBILITY STUDY ALSO IDENTIFIED CERTAIN ELEMENTS THAT WOULD SIGNIFICANTLY INCREASE RIDERSHIP AND REVENUES AND POTENTIALLY ALLEVIATE THE ISSUE OF OVERCROWDED BUSES ALONG THE FAIRMOUNT CORRIDOR. ONE OF THESE ELEMENTS INCLUDED CONSTRUCTING THREE NEW COMMUTER RAIL STATIONS THAT WOULD PROVIDE A HIGHER QUALITY LEVEL OF BUS SERVICE AND AN ALTERNATIVE MODE OF TRANSPORTATION IN WALK-TO STATIONS FOR NEIGHBORHOOD RESIDENTS ALONG THE CORRIDOR. SINCE THE STUDY WAS RELEASED THE MBTA HAS EMBARKED UPON SEVERAL OF THE RECOMMENDED ACTIONS INCLUDING CONSTRUCTING THREE NEW STATIONS (FOUR CORNERS/GENEVA TALBOT AVENUE AND NEWMARKET) ALONG THE RAIL CORRIDOR. THESE STATIONS OFFICIALLY OPENED FOR SERVICE IN SUMMER 2013. A FOURTH NEW STATION AT MATTAPAN IS IN DESIGN AND IS PLANNED FOR CONSTRUCTION IN 2014-15. IN ADDITION THE MBTA HAS MODERNIZED THE ALREADY-EXISTING STATIONS RECONSTRUCTED SEVEN RAIL BRIDGES AND UPGRADED TRACK AND SIGNAL INFRASTRUCTURE. THE PURPOSE OF THIS CAPITAL INVESTMENT WAS TO OPEN UP PUBLIC ACCESS TO THE LINE FOR EVERYONE INCLUDING PREVIOUSLY UNDERSERVED NEIGHBORHOODS AND TO EXPAND TRAVEL OPTIONS FOR FAIRMOUNT CORRIDOR RESIDENTS AND WORKERS MANY OF WHOM ARE LOW- AND MODERATE-INCOME MINORITIES. THE MBTA IS NEARING COMPLETION OF ITS 10-YEAR $200 MILLION TRANSIT CAPITAL INVESTMENT TO UPGRADE THE LINE. CURRENTLY MANY RESIDENTS BELIEVE THAT THE FAIRMOUNT/INDIGO LINE DOES NOT EXIST TO PROVIDE LOCAL SERVICE FOR THEM BUT THAT IT IS FOR COMMUTERS FROM OUTSIDE THE CITY. FOR DECADES THERE WERE FEW STOPS ON THE LINE AND THE EXISTING STATIONS HAD FALLEN INTO SIGNIFICANT DISREPAIR. IN ADDITION THE MBTAS RAPID TRANSIT/SUBWAY/LIGHT RAIL LINES LIKE THE RED LINE AND BLUE LINE DO NOT DIRECTLY SERVE THESE NEIGHBORHOODS. AS A RESULT RESIDENTS HAVE BEEN HEAVILY DEPENDENT ON MBTA BUS SERVICE A TRANSPORTATION MODE THAT IS HEAVILY BURDENED BY CONGESTED STREET TRAFFIC AND VEHICLE OVERCROWDING AND AS A RESULT IS OFTEN UNRELIABLE AND VULNERABLE TO DELAYS.PROJECTTHIS TCSP GRANT WILL BE USED BY THE MBTA WORKING WITH ITS COMMUNITY PARTNER THE FAIRMOUNT INDIGO LINE CDC COLLABORATIVE TO MAKE THE FAIRMOUNT LINE MORE VISIBLE TO LOCAL RESIDENTS AND LOCAL BUSINESSES AS A GOOD TRANSIT OPTION TO USE TO GET TO WORK SCHOOL AND STORES. THE GRANT WILL SUPPORT A MAJOR PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH CAMPAIGN TO INCREASE RESIDENTS AWARENESS OF THE FAIRMOUNT SERVICE OPTIONS INCLUDING FARE STRUCTURE AND HOW TO CONNECT FAIRMOUNT/INDIGO LINE TRIPS WITH LOCAL BUS SERVICE AND RAPID TRANSIT CONNECTIONS DOWNTOWN. THIS EFFORT IS NEEDED TO MAKE RESIDENTS AWARE THAT THE LINE IS INDEED FOR THEM AND TO FOSTER TRANSIT AS THE PRIMARY TRANSPORTATION CHOICE IN THE ROXBURY/DORCHESTER/MATTAPAN/HYDE PARK CORRIDOR. FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED TO DEVELOP A STRONGER RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN THE MBTA AND BUSINESSES IN THE FAIRMOUNT CORRIDOR AND TO MAXIMIZE THE MUTUAL BENEFIT THE UPGRADED LINE CAN HAVE LIKE ATTRACTING MORE SHOPPERS TO LOCAL BUSINESSES HELPING EMPLOYEES GET TO WORK AND ENCOURAGING INCREASED RIDERSHIP THROUGH LOCAL TICKET SALES. THE AVAILABILITY OF HIGH-QUALITY SAFE AND EFFICIENT TRANSIT WILL CONTRIBUTE POSITIVELY TO THE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT IN THE CORRIDOR AND WILL HOPEFULLY ENCOURAGE MORE BUSINESSES TO LOCATE AND/OR EXPAND IN THE AREA. IN ADDITION FUNDS WILL BE USED TO PILOT ENHANCED STATION AREAS WITH IMPROVED AND UPDATED DESIGN ELEMENTS AND PROGRAMMING TO ENLIVEN THE AREAS THEREBY INCREASING SAFETY ATTRACTING RIDERS AND DEVELOPING A SENSE OF PLACE THAT STRENGTHENS CONNECTIONS BETWEEN THE TRANSIT INFRASTRUCTURE THE NEARBY COMMERCIAL DISTRICTS AND THE NEIGHBORHOOD RESIDENTS. SCOPE OF WORKTHE PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON THREE TASKS:1) CORRIDOR OUTREACH ON TRANSIT SERVICE ACCESS USE PRODUCE INFORMATIONAL MATERIALS AND IMPLEMENT PUBLIC OUTREACH STRATEGIES TO INFORM RESIDENTS AND BUSINESSES ABOUT THE IMPROVED AND EXPANDED FAIRMOUNT RAIL SERVICE INCLUDING: ROUTES STOPS SCHEDULES FARE OPTIONS BUS AND RAPID TRANSIT CONNECTIONS AND MAJOR ATTRACTIONS AT OR NEAR STATIONS. DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN SOCIAL MEDIA PLATFORMS TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC ON THE FAIRMOUNT LINE. POSSIBLE PLATFORMS INCLUDE WEBSITES LINKED TO WWW.MBTA.COM FACEBOOK PAGES TWITTER AND OTHER TOOLS TO INCREASE COMMUNICATION AND THE FLOW OF INFORMATION.2) BUILD RELATIONSHIPS WITH LOCAL BUSINESSES ESTABLISH A WORKING GROUP OF MBTA AND FAIRMOUNT CORRIDOR BUSINESS REPRESENTATIVES LOCAL MAIN STREETS ORGANIZATIONS AND OTHER BUSINESS SUPPORT AGENCIES TO DEVELOP STRONGER LINKAGES BETWEEN THE RAIL SERVICE AND LOCAL BUSINESS DISTRICTS. PILOT A TICKET VENDOR SALES PROGRAM WITH ONE OR MORE BUSINESSES AT DIFFERENT STATIONS. OUTREACH TO LOCAL BUSINESSES ABOUT THE MBTA CORPORATE PASS PROGRAM FOR EMPLOYEES. DEVELOP AN ADOPT-A-STATION PROGRAM TO RECRUIT LOCAL BUSINESSES TO ASSIST WITH MAINTENANCE AND/OR OTHER STATION ENHANCEMENTS IN EXCHANGE FOR ADVERTISING SPACE OR OTHER BENEFITS.3) CONNECT THE STATIONS TO THE LOCAL COMMUNITY THROUGH PLACEMAKING STRATEGIES CONVENE PLACEMAKING CHARETTES AT CHOSEN STATIONS WITH KEY STAKEHOLDERS TO IDENTIFY STRATEGIES AND WORKPLANS TO ENHANCE STATION AREAS AND STRENGTHEN CONNECTIONS BETWEEN THE TRANSIT INFRASTRUCTURE AND THE NEARBY COMMERCIAL DISTRICTS. COORDINATE PLANNING OF STATION AREA IMPROVEMENTS WITH THE FAIRMOUNT/INDIGO LINE PLANNING INITIATIVE LED BY THE CITY OF BOSTON THROUGH THE BOSTON REDEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY. DESIGN ENHANCED SIGNAGE STREET FURNITURE AND/OR OTHER AMENITIES TO HELP DISTINGUISH THE NEWLY UPGRADED FAIRMOUNT LINE. IMPLEMENT A PILOT PROGRAM TO SHOWCASE THESE ENHANCEMENTS AT ONE OR MORE STATIONS. DEVELOP AND UNDERTAKE A PLAN OF PROGRAMMING AND OTHER PLACEMAKING STRATEGIES TO INCREASE PUBLIC ACTIVITY AT THE STATIONS THAT ENHANCE SAFETY ATTRACT RIDERS AND SHOPPERS AND LINK THE TRANSIT INFRASTRUCTURE TO THE LOCAL COMMUNITY AT TWO OR MORE STATIONS.OUTCOMES:BUILD RIDERSHIP COMPILATION AND DISSEMINATION OF WELL-DESIGNED PUBLIC INFORMATION MATERIALS ON THE FAIRMOUNT LINE SERVICE INCREASED USAGE OF ZONE 1A PASSES ON TRAINS BY AT LEAST 20% INCREASED LINE RIDERSHIP FROM 2013 BASE BY 20% IDENTIFY EFFECTIVE RIDERSHIP BUILDING STRATEGIES COORDINATION WITH MASS GREEN DOT IMPLEMENTATION PLAN ENHANCED COMMUNICATION BETWEEN THE MBTA AND CORRIDOR RESIDENTS AND RIDERS THROUGH SOCIAL MEDIA AND OTHER PLATFORMS GREATER PUBLIC AWARENESS AND CUSTOMER SATISFACTION BASED ON RIDER SURVEYS OR FOCUS GROUPS PARTICIPATION OF AT LEAST 150 CORRIDOR RESIDENTS EMPLOYEES AND BUSINESS OWNERS IN DIALOGUES WITH THE MBTA AND POLICY MAKERS ABOUT FAIRMOUNT SERVICEBUILD RELATIONSHIPS WITH LOCAL BUSINESSES ESTABLISHED WORKING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN THE MBTA AND CORRIDOR BUSINESS DISTRICTS. LOCAL BUSINESSES REPORT POSITIVE IMPACTS FROM NEW STATION OPENINGS FEASIBILITY DETERMINED FOR ESTABLISHING A FAIRMOUNT CORRIDOR BUSINESS ASSOCIATION AT LEAST ONE ADOPT-A-STATION AGREEMENT IN PLACE WITH A LOCAL BUSINESS AT LEAST ONE LOCAL EMPLOYER OFFERS THE MBTA EMPLOYEE PASS PURCHASE PROGRAM CONNECT THE STATIONS TO THE LOCAL COMMUNITY STATION ACCESS IMPROVEMENTS ARE COORDINATED WITH THE CITY OF BOSTON AND THE BOSTON REDEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY STATION AREA PLANNING EFFORTS NEW SIGNAGE STREET FURNITURE AND/OR OTHER AMENITIES WITH OVERALL FAIRMOUNT LINE DESIGN ELEMENTS ARE INSTALLED AT ONE OR MORE STATIONS INCREASED PUBLIC ACTIVITIES IMPLEMENTED AT TWO OR MORE STATION AREASTHIS PROJECT IS INCLUDED IN THE MOST RECENT STIP AND UPWP. MBTA IS CURRENT WITH CIVIL RIGHTS REQUIREMENTS MILESTONE PROGRESS REPORTS AND FINANCIAL STATUS REPORTS. ALL ADMINISTRATIVE AND STATUTORY REQUIREMENTS HAVE BEEN MET.

THIS IS AN FY18 HSCR GRANT AWARDED TO FULTON COUNTY (PROJECT ID D2019-HSCR-002) IN THE AMOUNT OF $365700 ($243778 FEDERAL $121922 LOCAL) TO EXPAND AND IMPROVE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR SENIORS IN NEED OR MORE RESPONSIVE LESS CUMBERSOME MOBILITY OPTIONS BY UTILIZING TRANSPORTATION NETWORK COMPANIES LIKE UBER AND LYFT. USING THESE FUNDS FULTON COUNTY WILL INCREASE RIDERSHIP IMPROVES ACCESSIBILITY FOR INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES AND CONDUCT RESEARCH ON THE PROGRAM MODELS EFFECTIVENESS AND COST-EFFICIENCY. ASTS (ALTERNATIVE SENIOR TRANSPORTATION SERVICES) ALLOWS AGING RESIDENTS TO FEEL MORE EMPOWERED INDEPENDENT AND MOBILE WITHIN THEIR COMMUNITIES.THE APPLICATION IS FOR HSCR FEDERAL ASSISTANCE AWARDED TO FULTON COUNTY. ARC AND FULTON COUNTY HAVE ENTERED INTO A MEMORANDUM OF AGREEMENT FOR ARC TO SERVE AS THE DIRECT RECIPIENT OF FULTON COUNTYS HSCR GRANT. ARC WILL ACT AS THE GRANTEE AND SUBGRANT THESE FUNDS TO FULTON COUNTY TO CARRY OUT THE PROJECT.THE GRANTEE OR SUBGRANTEE (WHEN APPLICABLE) WILL FOLLOW ALL 3RD PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES AS DEFINED IN C4220.1F(THIRD PARTY CONTRACTING GUIDANCE). THE GRANTEE OR SUBGRANTEE (WHEN APPLICABLE) WILL ENSURE CONTRACTORS WILL NOT BE ON THE FTA SUSPENSION AND DEBARMENT LIST.

THIS SCOPE OF WORK REFLECTS THE CONTINUATION OF THE TRANSIT STANDARDS DEVELOPMENT AND ASSISTANCE PROGRAM EFFORT AND THE ONGOING COMMITMENT TO THE PROCESS SPECIFICALLY FOCUSED ON STAKEHOLDER ENGAGEMENT AND RESEARCH GAP ANALYSIS AND RECOMMENDATIONS RELATED TO TRANSIT SAFETY STANDARDS IN 27 FOCUS AREA TOPICS COVERING RAIL AND NON-RAIL TRANSIT MODES. IT MAY ALSO INCLUDE RESEARCH DIRECTED IN SUPPORT OF TRANSIT STANDARDS THAT ARE NOT SPECIFIC TO SAFETY AS ASSIGNED.A. FEDERAL ROLE: THE FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION (FTA) WILL OVERSEE AND ACTIVELY PARTICIPATE IN THE PROJECT BY PROVIDING OVERALL PROJECT GUIDANCE AND DIRECTION ATTENDING MEETINGS COMMENTING ON TECHNICAL REPORTS AND OTHER DELIVERABLES MAINTAINING FREQUENT CONTACT WITH THE CUTR PROGRAM MANAGER AND REDIRECTING PROJECT ACTIVITIES AS AGREED ON BY BOTH PARTIES. IN ADDITION FTA RESERVES THE RIGHT TO REDIRECT THE PROJECT ACTIVITIES. B. RECIPIENT ROLE: CUTR WILL MANAGE THE PROJECT AS OUTLINED IN ITS APPLICATION INCLUDING MAINTAINING FREQUENT CONTACT WITH THE FTA PROJECT MANAGER; CONDUCTING PROJECT STATUS REVIEWS; PREPARING TECHNICAL AND FINANCIAL STATUS REPORTS; SUBMITTING DRAFT REPORTS AND A FINAL REPORT FOR FTAS REVIEW AND COMMENT; AND NOTIFYING FTA PROMPTLY OF ANY REQUESTED MODIFICATIONS UNEXPECTED PROBLEMS OR CHANGES. IN ADDITION CUTR WILL PROVIDE FTA WITH QUARTERLY MILESTONE/PROGRESS REPORTS PRESENTING THE STATUS OF THE PROJECT AND NEAR FUTURE DIRECTION STATING ANY FORESEEABLE PROBLEMS AND PRESENTING RESULTS OF THE PROJECT.BUDGET MODIFICATION AND PERIOD CHANGE INITIATED TO ACCOMMODATE MODIFICATION OF TTCI SCOPE OF WORK/SCHEDULE FOR THE HIGHWAY/PED CROSSING PROJECT. THIS IS TO EXTEND THE CURRENT PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE TO DECEMBER 31 2022.

BUDGET REVISION (SEPTEMBER 2022): THE WASHINGTON METROPOLITAN AREA TRANSIT AUTHORITY (WMATA) IS REQUESTING A PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE EXTENSION DUE TO PROCUREMENT/SHIPPING DELAYS AND INTERNAL COORDINATION REVOLVING AROUND TRACK ACCESS. THE DELAYS HAVE AFFECTED THE BUILDING AND SHIPPING OF THE MONITORS WHICH WILL DELAY THE INSTALL DATES OF THE MONITORS UNTIL NOVEMBER 2022. WMATA IS REQUESTING AN EXTENSION UNTIL SEPTEMBER 30 2023 TO COMPLETE THE PROJECT RESEARCH AND FINAL REPORT. THERE ARE NO BUDGET CHANGES. THE PROJECT MILESTONES WILL BE UPDATED IN THE NEXT REPORTING CYCLE. ORIGINAL AWARDTHE WASHINGTON METROPOLITAN AREA TRANSIT AUTHORITY (WMATA) IS APPLYING FFY19 INNOVATIONS IN TRANSIT PUBLIC SAFETY PROGRAM FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $176000 (FEDERAL) AND $44000 (LOCAL) FOR A TOTAL OF $220000 TO SUPPORT A CONTROLLED PILOT STUDY FOR EVALUATING METHODS TO REDUCE CRIME IMPROVE SAFETY IN SIX (6) WMATA METRORAIL STATIONS. METRO RIDERSHIP LEVELS CONTINUE TO BE SIGNIFICANTLY IMPACTED BY COVID-19. THE TIMELINE FOR PROJECT IMPLEMENTATION ASSUMES A RETURN TO MORE NORMAL LEVELS OF RIDERSHIP BY FALL 2021.ON JANUARY 28 2020 A FEDERAL REGISTER NOTICE (FRN) WAS PUBLISHED ANNOUNCING THE FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATIONS (FTA) SELECTION OF PROJECTS FUNDED UNDER THE FFY 2019 INNOVATIONS IN TRANSIT PUBLIC SAFETY PROGRAM. A COPY OF THE AWARD ANNOUNCEMENT AND THE COMPETITIVE APPLICATION IS ATTACHED IN TRAMS.THE NON-FEDERAL SHARE WILL BE PROVIDED BY THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA THE STATE OF MARYLAND AND PARTICIPATING JURISDICTIONS IN THE COMMONWEALTH OF VIRGINIA. THE POINT OF CONTACT FOR THIS PROJECT ARE JACOB PARK MARKETING MANAGER (JPAR@WMATA.COM) AND DEPUTY CHIEF STEPHEN BOEHM OF MTPD (SBOEM@WMATA.COM).

THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST SECTION 5312 FUNDS (D2020-HTIT-003) APPORTIONED TO INDIO - CATHEDRAL CITY CA (UZA #063180) IN THE AMOUNT OF $37320.FUNDING FOR ALL PROJECTS INCLUDED IN THIS GRANT APPLICATION IS PROVIDED BY THE FOLLOWING APPORTIONMENT YEARS:FY2009 5312 INNOVATIONS IN TRANSIT PUBLIC SAFETY FUNDS FROM CALIFORNIA UZA (060000): $37320 (D2020-HTIT-003)TOTAL LOCAL MATCH (STA): $9330TOTAL PROJECT COST: $46650PURPOSE OF THE AWARDTO CREATE AWARENESS ABOUT HUMAN TRAFFICKING AND SHARE INFORMATION REGARDING RESOURCES AVAILABLE FOR THOSE WHO HAVE BEEN AFFECTED BY HUMAN TRAFFICKING OR NEED ASSISTANCE IN BREAKING BINDS PUT IN PLACE THROUGH HUMAN TRAFFICKING SITUATIONS. IN ADDITION DO PUBLIC OUTREACH THAT HELPS IDENTIFY THOSE AT RISK AS WELL AS TO TEACH THE PUBLIC HOW TO PROTECT AND PREVENT INDIVIDUALS FROM BEING RECRUITED INTO HUMAN AND SEX TRAFFICKING OPERATIONS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED1. CAMPAIGN DEVELOPMENT: CREATE COMPELLING CAMPAIGN ASSETS THAT WILL BE USED IN ALL FORMS OF MATERIALS AND PSAS. THIS INCLUDES DEVELOPING HEADLINES A SLOGAN ARTWORK AND CONFIGURE THE CAMPAIGN TO FIT A VARIETY OF DIFFERENT FORMATS.2. IDENTIFY FORUMS FOR CAMPAIGN IMPLEMENTATION: CAMPAIGN WILL BE PRESENTED IN PUBLIC DISPLAY MEDIUMS.3. SET TIMELINE FOR DELIVERABLES: ONCE MEDIA PLAN IS IN PLACE AND THE PARTNERS ARE ON BOARD SUNLINE WILL CREATE A SCHEDULE WITH DEADLINES TO ENSURE CAMPAIGN IS PROPERLY EXECUTED. WEB PAGE WILL BE MONITORED TO TRACK HITS OF WEB TRAFFIC TO THE PAGE FOR THOSE ENGAGED AND LOOKING FOR INFORMATION.4. BEGIN CAMPAIGN IMPLEMENTATION: DEVELOP SLOGAN HEADLINES CALL-TO-ACTION MESSAGING; DESIGN PRINT CAMPAIGN; WRITE AND PRODUCE RADIO SPOTS; DESIGN AND PRINT BROCHURE COLLATERAL; SCHEDULE COMMUNITY OUTREACH EVENTS. START ALL FACETS OF CAMPAIGN SIMULTANEOUSLY.SUNLINE TRANSIT AGENCY IS HEREBY SUBMITTING THIS GRANT APPLICATION IN SUPPORT OF THE FOLLOWING CAPITAL PROJECTS:1) PROJECT ADMINISTRATIONTHIS GRANT APPLIES $37320 IN FY19 FEDERAL SECTION 5312 FUNDS FOR PROJECT ADMINISTRATION FOR SUNLINES ANTI-HUMAN TRAFFICKING CAMPAIGN. ALL OF SUNLINES OUTREACH RESOURCES AND PLATFORMS WILL BE USED INCLUDING LIVE TRAINING BUS WRAPS ONBOARD SIGNS PAMPHLETS POCKET CARDS TELEVISION ADS RADIO ADS AND DIGITAL PLATFORMS (E.G. SOCIAL MEDIA WEB PAGE TWITTER INSTAGRAM AND FACEBOOK). THE AGENCY IS COMMITTED TO SENDING A STRONG MESSAGE THAT HUMAN TRAFFICKING IS REAL AND IT WILL NOT BE TOLERATED. SUNLINE WILL FOLLOW MILLION KIDS SLOGAN NOT IN MY BACKYARD WITH A CO-SLOGAN NOT ON MY BUS. THIS GRANT FUNDS PROJECT ADMINISTRATION FOR DIRECT LABOR MATERIAL AND OVERHEAD EXPENSES FROM THE TIME PERIOD OF 07/01/21 TO 06/30/2022.EXPECTED OUTCOMESSUNLINE TRANSIT AGENCYS GOALS FOR ITS PUBLIC SERVICE OUTREACH CAMPAIGN CENTERED AROUND HUMAN TRAFFICKING ARE AS FOLLOWS:1. USE SUNLINES ADVERTISING PLATFORMS TO RUN PUBLIC SERVICE ANNOUNCEMENTS (PSAS) REGARDING HOW TO SPOT A TRAFFICKER OR AT-RISK INDIVIDUAL AND WHAT THE PUBLIC CAN DO TO HELP STOP THE RAMPANT AND MERCILESS CRIME OF HUMAN AND SEX TRAFFICKING. 2. INCLUDE EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS THE AGENCY DEVELOPS FOR THE PUBLIC SERVICE OUTREACH CAMPAIGN AT COMMUNITY OUTREACH EVENTS SUNLINE PARTICIPATES IN.3. PROVIDE CONTACT INFORMATION FOR RESOURCES AND NONPROFITS DEDICATED TO PUTTING AN END TO HUMAN AND SEX TRAFFICKING.INTENDED BENEFICIARIESSUNLINE WILL WORK WITH ITS CLOSE PARTNERS TO HELD EDUCATE AND BRING AWARENESS TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC BUT ESPECIALLY THE YOUTH THAT MAY BE AT RISK OF FALLING INTO THE TRAP OF HUMAN TRAFFICKING. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIESSUNLINE TRANSIT IS THE DIRECT RECIPIENT OF THESE FEDERAL FUNDS AND HAS NO SUBRECIPIENTS UNDER THIS AWARD.

THE WORK WILL BE IN SUPPORT OF CREATING AN INTEGRATED COHESIVE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION INNOVATION DEPLOYMENT NETWORK THAT IS RESPONSIVE TO THE NEEDS OF BOTH TRANSIT AGENCIES AND THE US TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURERS THAT SUPPORT ONGOING EFFORTS TO TEST DEPLOY AND COMMERCIALIZE LOW AND NO EMISSION VEHICLES AND RELATED COMPONENTS.THIS BUDGET REVISION REQUEST IS TO MODIFY THE END DATE OF THE PROJECT TO DECEMBER 31 2022 WITH NO OVERALL BUDGET CHANGE. THIS WILL ALLOW ENOUGH TIME FOR COMPLETING THE REMAINING PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDING FINAL PROJECT DELIVERABLES AND SUBMISSION OF INVOICES TO FTA FOR REIMBURSEMENT.

THIS APPLICATION REQUESTS $1551611 IN FY15 LOW OR NO EMISSION VEHICLE DEPLOYMENT PROGRAM (LONO) FUNDS. THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR THE TO PURCHASE 5 NEW FLYER BATTERY ELECTRIC REPLACEMENT BUSES WITH 5 DEPOT CHARGING STATIONS AND INSTALLATION. CONSULTING PROJECT MANAGEMENT SUPPORT FROM PROJECT PARTNER CENTER FOR TRANSPORTATION AND THE ENVIRONMENT (CTE) IS ALSO INCLUDED IN THE COSTS. THESE BUSES WILL REPLACE 5 EXISTING DIESEL BUSES IN AC TRANSITS FLEET. THIS PROJECT ALSO RECEIVES $3900000 FROM AC TRANSITS FY 2017 FORMULA GRANT APPLICATION: 1632-2017-4 ($3003000 IN FY17 5307 FUNDS $897000 IN LOCAL MATCHING FUNDS)AC TRANSIT FY 2015 LOW OR NO EMISSION VEHICLE DEPLOYMENT PROGRAM (LONO) GRANT APPLICATION:FY15 FTA 5312: $1551611FY17 FTA 5307*: $3003000CALIFORNIA AIR RESOURCES BOARD (CARB) HEAVY-DUTY VEHICLE INCENTIVE PROGRAM (HVIP): $690000LOCAL MATCH**: $968156*THESE FUNDS ARE APPLIED FOR IN A SEPARATE GRANT APPLICATION: 1632-2017-4 - FY 2017 FORMULA GRANT APPLICATION **MATCHING FUNDS ARE ALLOCATED FROM AC TRANSITS DISTRICT CAPITAL FUNDSAC TRANSIT COMPARATIVE ANALYSIS OF BATTERY ELECTRIC AND FUEL CELL ELECTRIC BUS PROPULSION TECHNOLOGIESTHESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO PURCHASE 5 NEW FLYER BATTERY ELECTRIC REPLACEMENT BUSES WITH 5 DEPOT CHARGING STATIONS AND INSTALLATION.
